<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 277, 232, 294]]<|/det|>
## MATHEMATICS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[836, 278, 907, 294]]<|/det|>
9709/21  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 303, 312, 319]]<|/det|>
Paper 2 Pure Mathematics 2  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[784, 303, 907, 319]]<|/det|>
May/June 2020  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[760, 329, 907, 345]]<|/det|>
1 hour 15 minutes  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 357, 395, 373]]<|/det|>
You must answer on the question paper.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 384, 390, 400]]<|/det|>
You will need: List of formulae (MF19)  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 418, 225, 434]]<|/det|>
## INSTRUCTIONS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 435, 875, 632]]<|/det|>
INSTRUCTIONS- Answer all questions.- Use a black or dark blue pen. You may use an HB pencil for any diagrams or graphs.- Write your name, centre number and candidate number in the boxes at the top of the page.- Write your answer to each question in the space provided.- Do not use an erasable pen or correction fluid.- Do not write on any bar codes.- If additional space is needed, you should use the lined page at the end of this booklet; the question number or numbers must be clearly shown.- You should use a calculator where appropriate.- You must show all necessary working clearly; no marks will be given for unsupported answers from a calculator.- Give non-exact numerical answers correct to 3 significant figures, or 1 decimal place for angles in degrees, unless a different level of accuracy is specified in the question.  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 664, 217, 679]]<|/det|>
## INFORMATION  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 680, 732, 712]]<|/det|>
INFORMATION- The total mark for this paper is 50.- The number of marks for each question or part question is shown in brackets [ ].

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 74, 92, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>2</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 73, 393, 92]]<|/det|>
The polynomial \(\mathrm{p}(x)\) is defined by

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[393, 100, 603, 120]]<|/det|>
\[\mathrm{p}(x) = 6x^{3} + ax^{2} + 9x + b,\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 127, 781, 145]]<|/det|>
where \(a\) and \(b\) are constants. It is given that \((x - 2)\) and \((2x + 1)\) are factors of \(\mathrm{p}(x)\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 158, 332, 177]]<|/det|>
Find the values of \(a\) and \(b\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 159, 920, 177]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 74, 94, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>3</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 73, 386, 92]]<|/det|>
A curve has parametric equations

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[373, 100, 623, 120]]<|/det|>
\[x = \mathrm{e}^{t} - 2\mathrm{e}^{-t},\qquad y = 3\mathrm{e}^{2t} + 1.\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 127, 695, 146]]<|/det|>
Find the equation of the tangent to the curve at the point for which \(t = 0\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 127, 920, 146]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 73, 96, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>4</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 73, 148, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 73, 920, 108]]<|/det|>
Sketch, on the same diagram, the graphs of \(y = |3x + 2a|\) and \(y = |3x - 4a|\), where \(a\) is a positive constant.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 120, 698, 139]]<|/det|>
Give the coordinates of the points where each graph meets the axes.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 120, 920, 139]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 448, 148, 467]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 448, 685, 467]]<|/det|>
Find the coordinates of the point of intersection of the two graphs.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 448, 920, 467]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[111, 757, 143, 775]]<|/det|>
<label>(c)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 757, 626, 775]]<|/det|>
Deduce the solution of the inequality \(|3x + 2a| < |3x - 4a|\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 757, 920, 776]]<|/det|>
<mark>[1]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 74, 146, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 73, 311, 92]]<|/det|>
Solve the equation

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[391, 92, 606, 112]]<|/det|>
\[\sin 2\theta (\cos \mathrm{ec} \theta - \sec \theta) = 1\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 116, 660, 138]]<|/det|>
for \(0 < \theta < \frac{1}{2}\pi\). Give the answer correct to 3 significant figures.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 117, 920, 136]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 432, 186, 451]]<|/det|>
<label>(c)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[180, 428, 435, 453]]<|/det|>
Find \(\int \sin x(\cos \mathrm{e} \frac{1}{2} x - \sec \frac{1}{2} x) \mathrm{d}x.\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 433, 920, 453]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 73, 99, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>7</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 73, 146, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 72, 920, 108]]<|/det|>
Find the quotient when \(9x^{3} - 6x^{2} - 20x + 1\) is divided by \((3x + 2)\), and show that the remainder is 9.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 87, 920, 106]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 532, 185, 551]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 529, 917, 592]]<|/det|>
Hence find \(\int_{1}^{6}\frac{9x^{3} - 6x^{2} - 20x + 1}{3x + 2}\mathrm{~d}x,\) giving the answer in the form \(a + \ln b\) where \(a\) and \(b\) are integers.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 570, 920, 588]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]

<|ref|>title<|/ref|><|det|>[[482, 46, 510, 63]]<|/det|>
# 12
